page.title: 04Energy
page.content: There is no production of energy in the area. The supply of electricity is by overhead cable which is subject to interruption by storms. As the lines go through woods which are often overgrown they somestimes touch trees causing breaks. There is no supply of mains gas. Many people use calor gas for heating & cooking to suppliment electricity. Some have battery generators as standby for central heating & milking machines. Most central heating is oil fired. Many homes have wood burning stoves as there is ready access to supplies of logs. A coal merchant delivers fuel from Edenbridge.
